radiographic_examinations.findings: Prominence of the portal triads. No focal intrahepatic lesion identified. No evidence of intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation. Portal vein patent with normal hepatopetal flow. Multiple small stones within the gallbladder, some stuck in the gallbladder neck, some mobile, and some adherent to the gallbladder wall. No gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. Common bile duct top normal to minimally dilated, measuring 6 mm. Pancreas not well visualized due to overlying bowel gas. No perihepatic ascites.
